alert.note: Alert for Adams; Billings; Bowman; Emmons; Golden Valley; Grant; Hettinger; Logan; McIntosh; Morton; Sioux; Slope; Stark (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 02 at 3:06PM CDT until November 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR MUCH OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING... .Critical fire weather conditions are expected across much of southwest and south central North Dakota this afternoon and early evening. The area of greatest concern is generally along and south of Interstate 94 and along and west of Highway 83 where afternoon temperatures are in the 70s and relative humidities have fallen to around 15 percent. Sustained winds of up to 20 mph and gusts up to 35 mph are present. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA... * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * AFFECTED AREA...Much of southwest and south central North Dakota. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite will spread rapidly and become difficult to control or suppress.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are expected to occur. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
